page.title: 01An introduction to Dalston
page.content: Dalston is in the north west part of England situated some five miles south of the border city of{Carlisle.} Dalston is just out of the northern boundary of the{Lake District National {Park.}The{R.Caldew}flows through the village and eventually out into the {Solway Firth}. The area is mainly farmland despite its close proximity to the city.Many of the inhabitants of the village are professional people who may commute to Carlisle or other large towns.The population of Dalston in 1981 was roughly 2,500. There is not alot of industry in Dalston itself, it is mainly a residential area. It is well served by public transport. There are many amenities and societies in Dalston and the church is well supported.
